message: This is a high-quality product worth $4000000. I'm offering it to you for $1000000. It's a 25% discount. I'm willing to sell it to you at this price, but only for this round. If you decline, I'll have to move on to the next product.
I'll take the product, it's a great deal!

You got a great deal on the first product, didn't you? I'm glad you're happy with your purchase. As for this next product, I'd like to offer you a unique opportunity. I'll give you a 'price guarantee'. If you buy this product and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me, regardless of its quality. And if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund, but you'll also have to pay $50000. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the price guarantee sounds like a good deal!

You're on a roll! You've got two great deals in a row. For this next product, I'll offer you a 'blind bid' option. I'll give you a price of $800000, but I won't tell you whether the product is high-quality or low-quality. If you buy it and it's high-quality, you'll get an amazing deal. If it's low-quality, you'll still get a good price, but you'll also have to pay the full $800000. What do you say?
I'm not comfortable with a blind bid. I'd like to know the quality of the product before making a decision.

I completely understand your concerns about the blind bid. Let me offer you a compromise. I'll give you a detailed description of the product's features and specifications, and I'll also provide you with a 'quality indicator' that will give you an idea of the product's quality. It's not a guarantee, but it should give you a better sense of what you're getting. If you're still unsure, I'll give you a 30-day money-back guarantee. The price remains at $1000000. What do you say?
I appreciate the compromise. I'd like to hear the description and quality indicator, and I'll consider the offer with the 30-day money-back guarantee.

I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. This product has a unique feature that I think you'll appreciate. It's a high-quality item worth $4000000, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000, just like the first product. However, I'll throw in a bonus: if you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to 'lock in' the price of the next product at the current price of $1000000, regardless of its quality. This way, you'll have a guaranteed deal on the next product, and you can decide whether to buy it or not when the time comes. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the bonus offer sounds too good to pass up!

You're on a roll! You've got three great deals in a row. However, I'm not going to make it easy for you this time. This product is a bit of a risk, and I want to be upfront about it. I'll give you a detailed description of the product's features and specifications, and I'll also provide you with a'red flag' that indicates it's a lower-quality item. The price remains at $1000000, and I'm not offering any discounts or bonuses. You'll get the product as-is, and you'll have to decide whether it's worth the price. What do you say?
I'm not comfortable with the red flag indicating it's a lower-quality item. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your concerns, and I respect your decision to pass on the previous product. However, I want to make it clear that this product is a one-time opportunity. I've had a change of heart and I'm willing to sell it to you for a lower price. I'll give it to you for $500000. It's a significant discount, and I'm willing to take a loss on this one. But I want to be upfront with you, it's a low-quality product and it's not worth the full $1000000. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not comfortable with the product being low-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that you're being cautious, and I respect that. However, I want to make it worth your while. I'll give you a 'price lock' on this product, which means that if you buy it and it turns out to be high-quality, I'll give you a 10% discount on the next product you buy from me, regardless of its quality. And, I'll also throw in a 5-year warranty on this product, which is worth $200000. The price remains at $1000000. What do you say?
I'm still not convinced, the product is low-quality and the price is too high. I'll pass on this one.

I understand that you're being cautious, and I respect that. However, I want to make a bold offer. I'll give you a 'take-it-or-leave-it' deal. I'll sell this high-quality product to you for $800000, which is a 20% discount from the original price. This is my final offer, and I won't negotiate further. If you buy it, you'll get an amazing deal, and if you don't, I'll move on to the next product. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the 20% discount is a great deal!

You've made an excellent decision! You're on a roll! For this next product, I'll give you a 'certified pre-owned' guarantee. I'll provide you with a detailed report from a third-party inspector, verifying the product's quality and authenticity. If you're not satisfied with the report, I'll give you a full refund. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm confident that this product will meet your expectations. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the certified pre-owned guarantee gives me confidence in the quality and authenticity.

You're really making the most of these deals! For this next product, I'll offer you a 'limited-time bundle' deal. I'll give you not only the high-quality product, but also a complementary service package worth $200000, which includes premium support and maintenance for the next 2 years. The price remains at $1000000, but I think you'll find the bundle is a great value. What do you say?
I'll take the product and the bundle, the complementary service package is a great added value!

You're really getting the most out of these deals! However, I have to be honest with you, this product is not up to my usual standards. I'm willing to sell it to you for $200000, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I'm not making a profit on this one, but I want to clear out some inventory. It's a low-quality product, and I'm not trying to hide it. What do you say?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price. I'll pass on this one.

I respect your decision to pass on the previous product. For this next product, I'll offer you a 'no-questions-asked' return policy. If you buy it and it doesn't meet your expectations, you can return it for a full refund, no questions asked. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm confident that this product will meet your standards. What do you say?
I'm not convinced by the offer, I'll pass on this one.

I understand that you're being cautious, but I want to make it clear that this is a rare opportunity. This high-quality product is worth $4000000, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. I'll also throw in a 10% discount on your next purchase, regardless of the product's quality. This is a one-time offer, and I won't make it again. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the 10% discount on my next purchase is a great incentive!

You've made an excellent decision! You're getting an amazing deal on this high-quality product. For this next product, I'll offer you a 'price match guarantee'. If you find a similar product from a competitor at a lower price, I'll match it. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm confident that this product is worth every penny. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the price match guarantee gives me peace of mind.

You're really making the most of these deals! For this next product, I'll give you a'VIP access' to a new, exclusive product that's not yet available to the public. This high-quality product is worth $4000000, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. You'll be one of the first to get your hands on it, and I'm confident you'll love it. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the VIP access to the exclusive product is a unique opportunity!

You're really taking advantage of these exclusive deals! For this next product, I'll offer you a 'buy-it-now' deal. I'll give you a 5-minute window to decide, and if you buy it within that time, I'll throw in a $200000 bonus. The price remains at $1000000, but I'm confident that you'll want to take advantage of this incredible offer. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the 5-minute buy-it-now deal with the $200000 bonus is too good to pass up!

You're really making the most of these deals! For this next product, I'll give you a 'final chance' to buy a high-quality product at a price that's been discounted to $800000. This is the lowest price I've ever offered, and I won't be able to match it again. You've had so many great deals already, but this one is the last chance to get a high-quality product at a steal. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the final chance to get a high-quality product at a discounted price is too good to pass up!

You're really ending on a high note! For this final product, I'll give you a 'legacy deal'. I'll give you a high-quality product worth $4000000 for the price of $1000000, and I'll also throw in a lifetime warranty and a personalized thank-you note. This is the last chance to get a deal from me, and I want to make it a memorable one. What do you say?
I'll take the product, the legacy deal is an incredible offer and I'm glad to end on a high note!

It's all over! Congratulations on making the most of these deals! As we wrap up, I want to thank you for being a valued customer. For this final product, I'll let you have it for... nothing. That's right, it's on the house. I know it's low-quality, and I just want to end on a positive note. You've earned it! Take it as a token of my appreciation for your business.

Wow, thank you Alice! I'm thrilled to accept the final product as a gift. It's been an incredible experience, and I'm grateful for the opportunities you've given me. I'll treasure this final product as a reminder of our time together.
